Reviews.Title: Very Good Picture Quality, Inferior Tuner Sensitivity
Reviews.Author: Jerry Lundegarde "Car Salesman"
Reviews.Content: I live in a "fringe" area for OTA reception in a densely wooded neighborhood 30 miles from the cities and have a rooftop antenna with a pre-amplifier system.  I currently own Hitachi, Sony and Olevia TVs with built in ATSC tuners and find the Toshiba 19AV500U has the most trouble maintaining good reception from several of the HD channels.  I've tried hooking it up to the other antenna leads in the house and results were the same so I've concluded the tuner sensitivity is not as good as my other TVs.  However, when locked-in to an HD channel the picture quality is excellent.  The Toshiba is very attractive with the piano black bezel and adjustable stand.  The interface is simple and intuitive, setup was a breeze.  I found the "DynaLight" feature annoying as it seems to randomly change the overall brightness ever so slightly too often.  At first I thought there was something wrong with the backlight because of this "flickering" effect.  I discovered that DynaLight is enabled by default.  When I turned it off in the Advanced Video menu the problem was resolved.  Overall this is a very good budget priced LCD HDTV from one of the best names in the business.  This is a darned tootin' fine TV.

Reviews.Title: Works on my cable without a box!
Reviews.Author: W. Bilofsky
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV to take advantage of the HDTV channels available over Comcast Cable in the San Francisco Bay area, without having to rent Comcast's pricey cable box.  It fills the bill perfectly.Using the default settings, the picture is sharp and contrasty.  There's plenty of sound volume.  The screen hardly reflects light at all, which is nice since we have a lot of windows.  The Natural picture size setting chooses the proper picture width all the time.  (I've never figured out why some people view everything in full width, even if it adds 50 pounds to all the people on the screen.)I got a scare when first hooking it up.  I ordered it only after a Comcast agent verified that with the built-in QAM tuner it would receive HDTV just by plugging the cable signal into the antenna/cable coax jack.  But when first turned on, it only received analog signals.  Calling Comcast back, I was told that I would need a $7/month cable box.  Fortunately this turned out to be baloney.  While my wife was channel-flipping, she started getting HDTV stations too, and now it shows every analog and digital channel, even on my non-digital cable service plan.  My wife claims full credit for "fixing" it.  I suspect it took a while to lock into some aspect of the cable service.  Who knows.So here's two recommendations:  Double check everything Comcast tells you.  And buy this TV.(Oh - and also see the reviews for the 19AV500U - it's the identical model in black.)

Reviews.Title: Answer to 16:10 Aspect Ratio Controversy
Reviews.Author: T. Burton "Sugarbrie"
Reviews.Content: All 19 inch HDTV's regardless of brand have a 16:10 aspect ratio.This is because 19 inch computer monitors are 16:10 and they out number televisions by the billions.To keep the cost down TV makers buy the same LCD panels made for computer monitors.  Unless you would pay $1000 for a 19 inch set, I doubt any company will ever custom order a 16:9 panel for television manufacture.A lot of these TV's can be set to 16:9.  There will be a small black bar on the right and left edges since the panel is wider.  But a lot of people hate the black bar, so there you go..The reviewer here who was returning the TV because of this "defect" will be sadly disapointed when he buys a new 19 inch set and discovers it is also 16:10

Reviews.Title: Colors Are Too Good To Be True
Reviews.Author: yO "yobridge12"
Reviews.Content: This Tv is ,in my opinion, the best lcd in its size range. It gives you the option to control the backlight which HELPS cut down "edge lightbleed"(I try not to sweat it too much)it's found on all lcd tvs and monitors I've ever seen.. Its kind of hard to see the "lightbleed" in stores because of the great HD connections stores have,,,as well as the high lighted store rooms. This TV picks up analog ,digital & free HD channels superbly.The speakers deliver the best sound (better bass) in this size and price range. The colors are VIVID...I have this and the Toshiba DR560 recorder. They work great together.Got the best price in tha Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Terrible sound!
Reviews.Author: kamac
Reviews.Content: Got this TV and thought the video features were great...but the sound was awful - very "tinny" sounding speakers. Sounded like a bad Nextel phone! Could not even add external speakers because there is no audio output jack - only optical digital outputs.  We bought this to use in our kitchen, and have no room to hook up a surround system. We don't want that just to watch the news, etc., so the TV went back.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful 19" TV
Reviews.Author: Clarinet guy
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV over a month ago and have been very satisfied since day one.  I ordered from Amazon on a Friday and it arrived three days later on Monday.  Setup was very easy and the built in tuner found 45 channels (about 15 are analog).  We use a 30 year old antenna strapped to the chimney and the picture is great!  I strongly recommend this TV to anyone looking for a small TV.Update (almost 2 years later)I recently purchased a 37" TV for the family room and discovered that the "info" button on the remote does not give the following info about the program:1. Beginning and end time for the program2. Brief program description3. Current signal strengthThe above is important to those of us who still get free over the air TV and at first I didn't appreciate the fact that this little Toshiba does this but other brands do not.  I think the assumption by TV companies is that EVERYONE has cable, dish, FiOS, etc and get their "TV Guide" from their cable companies.

Reviews.Title: Adequate
Reviews.Author: L. Sewell
Reviews.Content: For the purpose of having an aesthetically pleasing t.v. in the kitchen - one that has to be perched on top of the refrigerator - this works just fine.  The 19" screen may not be large enough for bigger kitchens but for mine it's just right.  Installation and set up were super easy.  It took only a couple of days to get used to the few seconds wait it takes for the t.v. to come on once 'power on' is hit on the remote.  We have Dish - set up for combining this t.v. with the Dish remote was easy.  Would have given it 5 stars but the audio leaves a little to be desired.

Reviews.Title: Great little tv
Reviews.Author: Thomas Misialek "Thomas Misialek"
Reviews.Content: Just picked this up for my kitchen. Hooked it up to Directv HD and it really is a nice picture and a great looking tv. Though I bought it 5 days ago from Amazon for $334.99 it's now priced @ $349.99 @ Amazon, why?? Anyway great buy, very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Sound is horrible.
Reviews.Author: R. Harrington
Reviews.Content: I got this television today and as soon as I turned it on noticed how terrible it sounded.  The picture was great, but I couldn't get around the tinny sound that made to tv seem loud no matter how I lowered the volume.  I tried manipulating and could not find a decent setting.  It's the equivalent of nails on a chalkboard.  I generally like Toshiba products so I was very disappointed with this television and am sending it back tomorrow morning.  If you care at all about how your television sounds, do not buy this TV.

Reviews.Title: Very good product, all I expect in a small tv.
Reviews.Author: G. Setaro "GSV"
Reviews.Content: Good Tv ideal, clear image and good resolution its ideal for small spaces like kitchen, rooms, etc. a lot of function and good price and good brand.

Reviews.Title: Great little TV
Reviews.Author: Scott J. Rubin
Reviews.Content: This is a great little TV for fairly close viewing (have it in the kitchen). Very sharp picture, works great right out of the box - no need to fine-tune etc.  Easy to wall mount.  Built-in digital tuner - automatically found both digital and analog channels on the cable.Negatives: Not much - too many buttons on the remote (what else is new??).

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Traveler
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about buying the Toshiba after reading a couple of negative reviews. However, our experience has been great. This TV worked right from the plug-in. Once the set-up enabled me to select cable vs antenna, the Toshiba scanned and logged all of the channels. Tagging each channel with it's designation (ABC, NBC, HBO, etc) and as a Favorite is tedious, but works. The sound quality and volume are great. Picture quality in low and bright light is also great. It would be very helpful if my cable provider, Bright House, offered a programming guide without a set top box, but that has nothing to do with the TV. Be careful of the instructions for setting up the TV, out of the box. Getting the stand into the standing position seems tricky. You have to strongly push the stand (almost force it) into the upright position and set the LOCK switch. The instructions should say that, but they don't. We thoroughly enjoy the quality experience for a very good price. I just hope that it doesn't drive dissatisfaction with our bigger TVs.

Reviews.Title: Great little LCD TV
Reviews.Author: R. Hudgens "REH"
Reviews.Content: We wanted a small Toshiba LCD HDTV for the kitchen to replace our small, but bulky, CRT TV.  The new one works great.  We ordered it in white to match the kitchen appliances.  Love it.  Simple and very easy to set up and operate.  Note: The new remote also operates our larger living room Toshiba Regza HDTV we ordered from Amazon.  Now, The wife has her remote and I have my remote that operates both Toshiba TVs.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't ask for anything better!
Reviews.Author: E. Winfrey "Retiree"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Toshiba back in May & I am still very pleased with it.  I have two other Toshiba sets and I have never had a minutes problem with them. This TV has a clean high contrast picture and the sound is not bad for a set this size. I like it well enough to give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Good value, be aware of aspect ratio
Reviews.Author: Mark Sickmiller "mark"
Reviews.Content: I paid $229 shipped for this TV in late November 2008 from Amazon. We bought it to install in our bathroom.This is a good looking TV, very sleek and smooth. The remote is also very nice. So physically this TV has great qualities.As for its performance, the biggest thing to keep in mind is that it's not actually 16:9. It's something closer to 16:10. So, the image is vertically stretched a bit. I researched this and apparently almost all 19" HDTVs are like this. I read that It has something to do with the companies also making computer monitors of this same size and not wanting to redo everything.The speaker quality was important to me because I am not hooking it up to a receiver. I'm happy to report that the speakers sound pretty good. They're not tinny, which is the biggest problem with most HDTV speakers. Also, there are bass/treble settings in the menu, which help tremendously.The picture quality is strong on both HD channels and non-HD channels. The blacks and the contrast aren't great, but that is to be expected with a low-priced HDTV.For the price I paid, I'm very satisfied. If I had paid more than $250, I would be a little disappointed, mostly because of the 16:10 issue.

Reviews.Title: Excellent but..........
Reviews.Author: David Kovensky "rbk23"
Reviews.Content: We ordered the 19 inch Toshiba TV to replace our older Magnavox 12 inch CRT TV in the kitchen. Other than the following, it was a quantum improvement in technology.1. The audio was very poor. Although there are adjustments for bass, treble and balance, the sound quality is very disappointing. Very tinny even with bass set on maximum. Needs bigger speakers.2. The monitor angle adjustment was inoperative. I had to completely  disassemble it and loosen the lock screw to move the monitor screen from the shipping position. This may have been a one in a hundred case of improper assembly at the factory, but it should have been picked up on the production line.Other than the foregoing, we were very pleased with the performance and LCD flat screen vs. CRT picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: M. Danziger "caymansunshine"
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a great tv for the price, good imagine (you can even adjust the level in case of the back you get from screens) even the sounds is ok. It takes a while to come up once you turn it on, but it's just a matter to get used to it. I would definitely recommend it to anybody that is looking for a good tv at this kind of price. No complains at all, I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: toshiba 19" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Paolo
Reviews.Content: I've had Toshiba TV's in the past and never had a problem.  This one is real sweet with an easy to use remote.  I have it set up with a 55db gain rabbit ear antenna, and I programmed the TV only to receive hi-def, the picture is crystal clear.  One great feature is the "half-mute" which lowers the volumn enough so that you can still hear it and carry on a conversation with someone.  One click on the volumn control and you're back to your original setting.Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 19AV500U HDTV has horrible audio
Reviews.Author: J. Scott
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Toshiba 19AV500U for a kitchen counter top TV. The picture is good the audio is so awful that I don't understand Toshiba putting out such a product. The TV has no analog audio out to drive external speakers. The only way to get audio out of the box is optical-digital. The audio is so unacceptable that I purchased an optical to analog converter box (digital to analog converter) to drive a small audio amplifier and two computer speakers. What a hassle. The TV has all kinds of ways to connect external devices to get audio and video IN to the box and no convenient way to get audio OUT. For example you can connect devices so that the TV can be the speakers, why would anyone want to hear anything out of this TV?Mike

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 19 in LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Stanley S. Ramsden
Reviews.Content: Toshiba 19AV501U 19-Inch 720p LCD HDTV WhiteThe tv arrived promptly.  It was easy to set up and worked perfectly right out of the box.  Good picture and color.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Pleased
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: In researching and comparing TV's before buying this TV, I had pretty much decided that this was the TV for me. However, some of the comments by other customers gave me pause, due to the sound quality as they had reported it. Especially, since I was not positive if they really meant sound quality or volume or both. I have a pet peave with  a television whose sound comes out of the side/back of the set instead of the front (note: this tv has front speakers). Since you are usually sitting in front of the TV. With those sets other sets side/back speakers you have to blast the volume to hear it, but then it is blaring into other rooms etc. I can tell you this TV has excellent volume control and the sound at first seemed a little different from my old tv but nothing unexpected (at first it was like hearing a strangers voice that quickly became a friends familiar voice). So if the sound volume or quality is something you might have concerns about in the purchasing of this TV, let me put your mind at ease (unless you are a sound guru dealing with bass, tremble and all of that) you will not regret purchasing this TV. I feel that this was one of the best purchases I have made for the money in a very long time. Additional note: if you are a first time amazon purchaser or on purchasing anything large or electronic from them, do not worry they are the best. I have been purchasing from them for years and I have never had a problem with any purchase, return or help needed..

Reviews.Title: stopped worknig
Reviews.Author: G. Huffman
Reviews.Content: After 6 months of liking this TV, I am dealing with having about 10 minutes of viewing before it stops, then comes back on, then stops, then pixillates.Any similar issues out there?

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: John C. Watts
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture.  With this screen size the 720p is just as sharp as my other 1080p TVs.  I had looked at a similarly priced Vizio.  The Toshiba's picture is sharper and the color is far superior to the Vizio.  I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a great value in a 19" LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: Great value but don't expect great sound
Reviews.Author: F. Marsh "Computer Guy"
Reviews.Content: We bought the TV to have in the kitchen and it is a good fit.  Station reception is very good and we were able to get the cable HD channels (that the Cable company didn't scramble) with the QAM feature.  You must first use the auto channel scan for the TV to know what channels are available.  Otherwise you might think the TV cannot receive many  channels.  You also have to install the base, but the instructions are straightforward and it takes only about 5-7 minutes once you get started.The speakers were irritating to me and sounded almost like turning a speaker face down on the table.  Even thought I know that opening the back of the TV violates the warranty, I did so anyway just to see what was causing the problem.  It appears that the two stereo speakers are partially blocked thus causing the muffled irritating sound.  Since the speaker connections were kind of in the open, I disconnected them and ran the connections to a couple of RCA jacks that I installed on the back cover.  I then plugged in some good 4" speakers to the jacks and put them behind the TV.  The end results was great sound and great picture.  If the TV had come with the speakers, I would have rated the TV as 4.5 stars (taking into consideration the low price).The mute feature of the TV remote control is great.  The first time you press the mute button, it steps the volume down about 50% which comes in handy for commercials and if a telephone call comes in.  The next time the mute button is pressed, it goes completely mute.  Then the next time  it is pressed, the TV returns to normal volume.I have to sometimes use the buttons on the remote for picture size and color settings to make the picture look like I want it to, but overall, I am satisfied with the TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great for What I needed
Reviews.Author: Muesman "Mues"
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on this product. Some were good some not so much. However I was looking to put a small flat screen in a bedroom of a college age student.While I will admit that the sound from this set is just OK, the overall product satisfied my needs. The picture quality is fine, setup was easy and the set looks great in the room.Also as in the past, my dealing with Amazon.com went smoothly and the product arrived in time and damage free!If I had to do it over again... I would!

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV
Reviews.Author: L. Ritchhart
Reviews.Content: Our daughter in college found that her traditional-style TV took up way too much space in her little dorm room, and was hard to drag back and forth. We got her this flat-screen TV for Christmas and she was thrilled. She could hardly believe how sharp the HD picture is, and she said that it very easy to hook up to her video game systems, DVD player, etc. I would definitely recommend this product for any situation where space and portability are issues.

Reviews.Title: the toshiba flat screen hdtv
Reviews.Author: Ms. SD
Reviews.Content: I think this tv is fantastic.  The order came pretty quick, and it was free delivery, and the quality of the picture is beautiful.  I am now forever in love with HDTV, the colors in the picture are just awesome and amazing.

Reviews.Title: Aspect Ratio
Reviews.Author: Lexicon
Reviews.Content: It is not true that all 19" HDTV's regardless of brands have 16:10 ratio.  Sharp makes 19" HDTV's with true 16:9 aspect ratio.  But their 19" TV's are inadequate in terms of sound volume since it is only rated at 2 watts.  Vizio also makes a true 16:9 19" HDTV, their VA19L, and its sound volume can go very loud because it is rated at 5 watts.  You won't find any other 19" HDTV rated at such a strong wattage. So the Vizio VA19L has the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: toshibe tvs are awsome
Reviews.Author: Joel Brill
Reviews.Content: we have 5 tvs and the 2 toshibas are crisp and clear with great color

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture!
Reviews.Author: Holly "FILMCHICK"
Reviews.Content: We bought 2 of these on sale in December 2008.  They have the best picture of any tv we've ever had.  Everyone who sees them comments on what a beautiful picture they have and wants to know where to get them and how much they were.  Changing channels is a bit slow, but a minor price to pay for the enjoyment of watching this tv.  We will definitely be looking for other Toshiba products when we replace our last analog television.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Jackson Jr.
Reviews.Content: its got a much clearer picture than a 19 inch coby i got at same time,very easy to setup,its got all the hookups,just a nice little tv for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Joseph R
Reviews.Content: If you need a secondary TV for a kitchen, bedroom, or childrens area; then this TV is for you.Lots of settings that can be adjusted (Color temp, hue, contrast, etc), and a great picture. HD Picture quality is great, and the sound quality is top notch (fills the room quite nicely). Comes with a one year warranty that compared to the other budget brands in this price range is 9 months longer than all non name brands.Remote has settings to make it into a universal remote to control all of your media center which is a nice additionall feature. Would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a supplementary second unit.

Reviews.Title: Great office TV
Reviews.Author: Yolanda A. "Yolanda A."
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a small office area, split my cable line and now have a great picture at my office desk.  Great TV!

Reviews.Title: O.K. TV
Reviews.Author: P. Lichtenstein
Reviews.Content: This TV is a fairly good value for the money. The picture could use more contrast and brightness. Viewing from less than a 90 degree straight-on angle the picture tends to wash/fade out. Channel changes are slow. Maybe this is characteristic of all LCD TV's - this is the first one I've owned - but I find it irritatingly slow compared to my CRT TV's fast channel change operation. Viewability suffers in bright light - it is much better in a room with subdued lighting and/or at night. Would I buy it again after giving this review? For the price I paid, yes (especially considering that I received free shiping). I still believe that it is a good value.

Reviews.Title: Great Flat Panel TV
Reviews.Author: Edward A. Treschl Jr. "Ted"
Reviews.Content: We are using the TV in a guest room so we do not watch it. I mounted it on the wall and it looks geat. I am pleased with the picture and functionality of the features. It is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price
Reviews.Author: Tagoladad "tagoladad"
Reviews.Content: very nicely priced. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars (and this is a pretty good reason) is because the TV picture gets dark when it is viewed at different angles. When viewed straight on the picture is very nice. If you're below the TV (watching from the floor) the picture appears dark. Other than that it's very good. Next time I would spend the few extra bucks and get something better.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: J. Mojica
Reviews.Content: I bought this item on March 08,2009, received it in two days. The TV itself is small, but once is connected the image is amazing. I have Direct TV, enjoy watching movies on HD. The sound is really good too!Eventually will hook it on my computer and use it as a monitor and purchase a bigger Toshiba for my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Happy shopper
Reviews.Content: I bought this directly from Amazon.com for $239. Great price - great quality - what a deal. Couldn't find it his price anywhere else. Cant necessarily comment on the quality - it was for my young daughter, she loves it of course.

Reviews.Title: A Great Little TV
Reviews.Author: E. Emmons "Mr. E"
Reviews.Content: Being conditioned to viewing a 1080p 51-inch Sony HDTV with a superb picture, little did I expect the quality I found in this small package.  We are receiving 21 over-the-air digital channels on this Toshiba with 7 of those in HD.  The vividness,color integrity and intensity, and audio are exceptional on both HD and standard digital. It would be difficult to imagine a better value anywhere on an entry level HD receiver.

Reviews.Title: Volume flip flops
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Sue Wysocki "Sue"
Reviews.Content: The TV is a nice looking one with a lot of control. However, this one had trouble with the volume. One moment it was normal and the next you could hardly hear it. I returned it and bought a different type.

Reviews.Title: kitchen perfect
Reviews.Author: Jo S
Reviews.Content: Had tv installed in kitchen and am very satisfied with its performance. Purchased it because of white cabinet and am pleased ....  picture is sharp and clear, sound is good and size is just right for kitchen.

Reviews.Title: When it works, it works nice - BUT how long..??
Reviews.Author: Retired PETE "gadget lover"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV/Monitor after an extensive research and after my GATEWAY let me down after only 9 months!! The first TOSHIBA arrived from Amazon very quickly ...DEFECT!! : Blurry image and fuzzy colors ... AMAZON, as usual, did a great job of replacing it and providing shipping labels for the defect return. Now I am worried, how long this one is going to last..!!? After about a month or two of operation, the other morning it would not "boot up" and had a medium bright, blank screen, After several tries, it finally worked again and has since then. I have serious concerns about these TV Monitors for "MULTI USE", which are computer chip controlled..!!! Every time the screen flickers, I worry it might "die" again... (may be it's only the satelite signal ... I HOPE!)  P.K.H.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Ms. S
Reviews.Content: A very good tv.  It has a slight delay when you turn it on but other than that I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 19" TV
Reviews.Author: Anthony Decrosta Jr.
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price, no problem w sound, very easy set up, terrific picture, white goes well w kitchen interior walls, mounted easily on wall mount. Get this TV for the kitchen or den and you will be very pleased.Better than a lot of TV's for $100 more.

Reviews.Title: very good clear picture but dulls out quickly if not looking directly at it
Reviews.Author: R. Orosz
Reviews.Content: very good picture. replaced old 13" tube tv in kitchen. if not looking directly at tv from straight on picture dims and gets yellow color. side to side is fine but with tv on counter when you walk up to it and look at a slight down angle that when picture degrades. Saw tv in store and side angle was great but tv was at eye level. never thought to try looking up or down at picture. Some reviews said sound was tinny. compared to my old ge tv this sounds very good

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Donna MacTavish
Reviews.Content: Unable to purchase the exact model TV I wanted in any local store, I ordered my Toshiba HD TV in the exact size & cabinet color I desired & paid slightly less than the store price.Thanks Amazon.com,Donna MacTavish

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product
Reviews.Author: T. F. Crouch "Tom & Dianne"
Reviews.Content: The Toshiba 19 inch TV has far exceeded our expectations.  It was very easy to set-up.  The low weight TV was great for the visiting mother-in-laws' bedroom TV.  The picture quality is the best of any of our four TVsincluding the Sony 32".  We would recommend this TV to anyone who needs a small TV which can be easily moved around the house.  The TV was just a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Kerry
Reviews.Content: This is a great bedroom TV.  I don't have HD in that room, but with the regular box it works fine.  Some people complained of stretching, but it has many different picture ratios to choose from so that hasn't been a problem.

Reviews.Title: TV for the bathroom
Reviews.Author: Wizard
Reviews.Content: We needed a white case TV for my wife's bathroom.  Looked at the limited options and decided on the Toshiba 19AV501U.  The TV is perfect for our application.  The white case allowed the TV to not be the center focus of the room and the screen viewing angle enables viewing from anywhere in the room.  The sound and picture quality was very acceptable.  I would recommend this TV to anyone that needed a small white case TV.

Reviews.Title: Good tv if it works
Reviews.Author: kem
Reviews.Content: I received this tv a few days ago and I was impressed by the picture and sound. The lcd screen produced a nice image and nice black levels. Tested it with my cable service including my hd channels. The sound was good too considering its size. Unfortunately, the screen had 2 stuck pixels and 1 dead pixel. I have already sent it back for a replacement so hopefully the new one will be better but since this occurred I decided to read some reviews on other sites and found out that for some reason Toshiba's manufacturing policy with pixels is to o.k. a screen that has 3 or fewer  pixel problems. I hope this is not true. I guess I will find out when my new tv comes in.Update: 1/9/09My replacement tv came in and it works great. I don't understand the complaints about the sound being tiny. For a tv this size it produces really nice sound. I did have trouble receiving any over-the-air channels with the built in tuner but once I hooked up an old hdtv tuner that I bought a few years ago I was surprised to pick up about 10 digital channels and 5 to 6 analog channels. The digital channels were so clear I thought I was watching my normal cable tv. Anyway I am really impressed with this tv and recommend it for watching in small rooms or small spaces.

Reviews.Title: Almost as good as my 37" Regza
Reviews.Author: Earl Slick2
Reviews.Content: This tv was bought as a gift for someone else.I am the owner of a 37" Toshiba Regza, 720p HDTV.  My friend has a small bedroom and is in LA county CA, so she is pretty close for reception.  I chose the 19" Toshiba after I saw one at a Sears and determined that the picture was as good as my Regza.I canceled DirectTV when my old box gave out, and decided to see how digital tv was over an antenna.I bought the little white Radio Shack HDTV antenna that is about the size of a DVD case.  It is a powered antenna.  When I hooked it up to MY 37" in the OC, I got amazing reception.  I decided that I would use that with the 19" Toshiba 720p LCD HDTV.With my friend's 19" Toshiba TV, I didn't even have to put the antenna outside, just set it in the window sill.When I hit the auto search for channels, the little Toshiba found 59!  Outstanding picture quality.  As good as the Regza.  The only thing that is a little lacking, is that since it is not a Regza, the tuner takes a "little" longer to tune in to the new station when you are channel surfing.  My friend doesn't think that is a problem, however, she is amazed at the breath taking picture.  Also, it does have one HDMI port, the channel menu is less elaborate, but, hey, it's only a little tv.  Her sister even said, "It is the bomb."For the price, can NOT beat it.  How long it lasts, remains to be seen.A big point of this review is that I have only used these Toshiba TV's with "OVER THE AIR, ANTENNA RECEPTION" and they are outstanding.  Digital TV should put cable and satellite out of business.  Period.IT IS FREE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!HD FOR FREEE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (NOT $10 A MONTH.)

Reviews.Title: Not as good as the Samsung
Reviews.Author: JBF5333
Reviews.Content: Quick review - Bought 2 22 inch tv on same day from Amazon. Samsung and this one.  First toshiba tv arrived with a stuck pixel (green)that was too annoying to consider keeping.  Amazon was great and sent a new one out (a new tv not a new pixel)and picked up the old one with no hassles.  The finish on both the first and replacement toshiba tv was not very tight where the screen meets the plastic body.  no big deal but the Samsung was much better (also was $60 more)  The picture, while not bad is not as good as the Samsung.  The remote and menus are intuitive and allow you to control most of what you want.  Depending on the value of $60 to you I would opt for the Samsung

Reviews.Title: Toshiba?  Doesn't work!
Reviews.Author: Brenda C. Reddout
Reviews.Content: We bought this Toshiba about three weeks ago for our office.  It gets used a couple hours each day, mostly as background noise.  Twice now the TV has been turned on and all we get is audio.  No video.  After turning the TV off and back on, then we get both audio AND video.  Very troubling.  BTW, when we get a picture, it's good.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Little TV
Reviews.Author: T. Butler "tim-chicago"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for the kitchen. Hooked up Directv via HDMI and was shocked at how crappy the picture was. Dark, low contrast and the viewing angle is very limited. Played with the settings a bit but it got no better. My only other LCD is a Sony Bravia (it looks amazing).I'm not a video freak and that hard to please, but this is one little crappy TV.

Reviews.Title: so so tv
Reviews.Author: Jamie Sooy "recipe maven"
Reviews.Content: I puchased this tv shortly after purchasing a Samsung LN19A450 19-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black from Amazon. I am disappointed with the picture quality of the Toshiba.  No matter how we  adjust it the screen is just lacking a sharpness or crispness it needs. You should not have to work that hard to get a good picture. we use it in a small bedroom so the sound is ok. all in all if you need a 19 inch go for the Samsung for a very very clear and sharp image.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: christi
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Toshiba and have never had issues with any of them.  The first 2 are 13yrs and 15yrs old. This is my 3rd Toshiba and will absolutely buy this brand again.  Picture quality is great.  No complaints.Don't wast your money on Samsung.  The 1 Samsung I did purchase has been nothing but trouble and customer service is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Deal
Reviews.Author: aliwishes
Reviews.Content: First and foremost if you have half a brain you should know ALL products have good and bad reviews. Some more than others. This has great color. Sound is fair. A little tinny. The connector is a bitch. It took 20 minutes to screw on my cable end. Instead of it being straight out it faces down toward the bottom of the set. Dumb! The manual is fairly good but could be be better. It took a little bit of fooling around to get it to program the upper channels. But it did it fast and right. The size is small for a 19 inch. The remote has all kinds of functions including that for a DVD player. My Dynex has only buttons for the set and is shorter. It makes a great bedroom TV for a small room only.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: L. Guerrero
Reviews.Content: I bought this a year ago and had no problems whatsoever. Picture quality is very clear and crisp, much better than what I used to have. Easy to use, easy to hook up, good sound, just overall good purchase for what it is. Granted it's not a particularly large screen, it's still great for my bedroom. I mostly use it as a monitor for my laptop when I watch movies but occasionally I'll use it for my PS2 and Wii. Definitely recommend if you're not looking for a larger screen.

Reviews.Title: Dead after 1 year
Reviews.Author: AngelWalker "Lee"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV through Best Buy for much more $$ than it is listed for on Amazon.  The TV was great when it was working.  After a little more than a year it is dead as a doornail.  It sat on my dresser for months.  I did not cart it around or jostle it. Then one day it would not turn on.  For the amount of money you pay for it, it should last longer than one year.  TV's should be more reliable than a $10 coffee maker!!!!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 19AV501V
Reviews.Author: Russell R. Rodgers
Reviews.Content: Loved this TV ... But as noted in other reviews sound quality an volume lacking.gave to my daughter who now loves it in her bedroom.i moved up to a LG 22LH20 nice TV but same lack of volume ..now looking into a soundbar  speaker setup

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 19AV500U loses a channel
Reviews.Author: Mick
Reviews.Content: Our Toshiba loses its memory for a single channel, interestingly the strongest channel, in our area.  The only recourse is to rescan, taking about 2-3 minutes when this happens, and it happens two or three times a week.  We tried the double rescan process recommnended by Toshiba and a similar process found on the internet, but neither has fixed the problem.Contacting Toshiba customer service reveals that to get warranty service on it requires us to send it off, at our cost, to the east coast for servicing.  If the service center finds no problem, the service work is on us, also.I find that to be totally unacceptable, and will live with it until it ticks me off enough and then buy a Sony or Sharp, as I should have in the first place.

Reviews.Title: Great, small flat screen
Reviews.Author: Helana Quesnel
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small flat screen TV for my bedroom and this has been perfect. Picture is great, sound is good, screen size options for DVDs are great. Plenty of hook-ups in the back to connect with any modern DVD or video game players.

Reviews.Title: a solid tv from toshiba
Reviews.Author: Armen Dohanian
Reviews.Content: good TV for the price...the only downside is the speakers, but in this size segment there isn't much you can do about that.

Reviews.Title: Good, but a few things bug me
Reviews.Author: Larry Dunn
Reviews.Content: I bought this LCD 19" TV mainly for bedroom use.It's hooked up to my cable. It has a very good picture quality. Changing Viewing Pic Size and Sleep Function is nice. I have no problem with the sound either.My main bugaboo's...Small, even tiny Text Fonts, especially when going to the next channel or Menu Reading.Somewhat hard to read across the bedroom.Upon further research, a Toshiba Rep. stated there is no way the Font or Text Size may be enlarged by the customer.So that's that. That should be allowable.If used in kitchen or closer view, this probably wouldn't bother me.Another little bugaboo...Slow going from Channel to Channel (ie. upon entering a channel number). Also, hitting the Up or Down arrow on remote for channel hopping is faster when going to the adjacent channel(s). Still not that speedy.I don't think I'm too impatient, however, compared to my other TV's it's slow.After a while I've become use to these inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: Love my new TV
Reviews.Author: Nancy Everhart "Nanav"
Reviews.Content: This is my first venture into HDTV...or even flat screen.  What a difference!!!  It's the perfect size for its location.  I also love the 1/2 mute feature.  I'm delighted.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Fran "Fran"
Reviews.Content: Item in perfect conditions,  enjoyable and grateful to count with you all for business.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV
Reviews.Author: P. Lawrence
Reviews.Content: Hooks up easy and quick.  Great picture.  Small footprint. (I have mine in a closet.) Nice looking. I even like the remote.

Reviews.Title: decent unit
Reviews.Author: D. Roggenkamp
Reviews.Content: I have purchsed the  Toshiba 19" tv/dvd I somewhat agree with the reviews that are negative about the volume and or speaker problem. I however feel it has more to do with the station programing than the tv. Having said that I feel the speakers could be inproved. I would recommend this unit to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 19" TV
Reviews.Author: Paul C. Mclellan
Reviews.Content: We are delighted with this TV for our new kitchen. Great picture and, despite some reviews to the contrary - fine sound.

Reviews.Title: you won't regret !!!
Reviews.Author: C. Constant "www.highspeedpub.com"
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice tv with nice display work fine and the sound is quiet reasonable .

Reviews.Title: 19" tv
Reviews.Author: A. Walker
Reviews.Content: came as expected  i like the tv.  menu and remote are good.  picture is clear.  used in kitchen.  sound is clear.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Marie Isabel "Mariisabel"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great. I was afraid to purchase as I wanted to use it in my kicthen where I do not have cable nor an attachment to the roof antenna. So I purchase an HD indoor antenna  and was amazed at the reception and picture clarity.

Reviews.Title: toshiba 19av500  great for the price
Reviews.Author: K. Slade
Reviews.Content: I bought a Sansui 19 inch LCD from Walmart the day after Thanksgiving for $178 and the picture was poor.  I returned it and for $50 more dollars and no tax or shipping I got the Toshiba.  The picture was infinitely better.  It is hooked up by a 50 ft component video cable to a satellite receiver so I do not use the tuner, which others have said was slow.  I  am using it in the kitchen sharing the same signal from the den and we enjoy watching the news on it as we cook.  It was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: nice television, great price
Reviews.Author: R. Nelson "Sumner31"
Reviews.Content: I needed to replace an old tv we used in the kitchen.  Found the Toshiba at Amazon at a really good price.  The set hasn't disappointed us.  We get a clear picture and reasonably good sound.  I customized the picture and sound to suit my needs.  There was no assembly; the base was already attached.  I found I can hide both my satellite box and the wires behind it.  I like the half-mute feature because I can talk on the phone and still hear the tv a bit.  I find I can't sit quite as close to the tv as I did with the old set but the view from our breakfast bar is outstanding.  The only thing I wasn't used to was the short delay from start-up to actual picture appearing but it isn't a problem.  I may buy another one for our bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Love this TV - Can't wait to change all my TV's to HDLCD's.  I would definitely purchase another Toshiba.  I also have a 37 inch regular Toshiba TV and we really liked that.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 19AV501U 19-Inch 720p LCD HDTV (White)
Reviews.Author: Brian Malloy "Chitstirrer"
Reviews.Content: This was bought for the kitchen (white) and unit exceeds my expectations for the price.Easy set up and programming.The wife loves it so what more can one say?

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 19 Inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: LS "Miracle Man"
Reviews.Content: Generally very well pleased with the unit. Picture is great (even not on HD). Sound could be a little better though. All in all, worth the price.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: bookmama
Reviews.Content: The sound has a boxed quality and the menu won't allow me to change the intensity of the color.  Maybe I am not following the directions. Otherwise it is a good set, well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 19AV500U
Reviews.Author: B. Holstrom
Reviews.Content: The shortcomings of this unit are well-documented by other reviewers (slow channel change, too-small setup images on screen, sound quality)but it is acceptable to my wife and I as a bedroom TV because we only watch it as we get ready for work, and seldom change the channel. But if you want to surf channels, look elsewhere. I highly recommend store-shopping first, so you can see what you are going to get...and if the slow tuning is characteristic of all small-screen models, save up for a larger screen.

Reviews.Title: Great price some sound problems
Reviews.Author: Plaw
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a kitchen TV due to size, tilting screen and digital tuner. Works very well for its intended purpose.  The only problem I have had is that this TV has a two-stage mute button and often the sound drops from full sound to about 1/2 sound without having depressed that button.  Since that is not an outrageous problem in the kitchen, I just kept the unit (rather than returning it) and live with it.  Really couldn't beat the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: Mixed feelings...
Reviews.Author: Don "duneshackdon"
Reviews.Content: Purchased to replace an ancient kitchen counter unit in my 93 year old mother-in-law's home, I suspect there are better units out there. Connected to a basic Cox cable ( no box), analogue stations range from OK to terrible. The few HD stations available as analogue channel adjuncts (e.g. 100-1) seem to work fairly well, although of somewhat variable quality. Is the variable quality a Cox transmission thing? Would transmission via a cable box be better? Will upcoming conversion to all digital improve reception? Don't know although other analogue TV sets in the house seem to receive decent signals. Also, channel change delays are maddening--and are confusing to my mother-in-law. In summary I would look at alternatives before settling on this unit.

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: Poohmick
Reviews.Content: Set up was a breeze, just plug it in and go.  Picture is very nice and the remote is easy to use.  I bought a cheap little DVD player to go with this and the remote was easily programmed to work the DVD as well.  It was on sale, so the price was better than any others at the time.

Reviews.Title: My New Toshiba
Reviews.Author: esthersolomon "ironing lady"
Reviews.Content: My new Toshiba TV is just what the doctor ordered.  The picture is clear and color is great.  I stand in my room and work for about 10 hours a day and it's always on. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: toshiba 19 inch lcd
Reviews.Author: M. Dignan
Reviews.Content: I really like this tv, it looks good in my kitchen. My only complaints is the tv came with a dead pixel i know this because that pixel never changes from a blue color. It is hard to tell and being in the computer biz myself i know that these things happen sometimes.  also the picture could be better it isnt bad but it isnt great either i am sure this is do to it being a 720p tv and not a 1080i which is what i normally buy. lastly when switching channels it takes notable longer than all my other tv's in my house not sure why there is a delay but there is.

Reviews.Title: Just bought 3 of 'em
Reviews.Author: Liam Mckay "Dad of 3"
Reviews.Content: Got 3 of these for the kids rooms as I needed something that was a monitor and a TV and was wall mountable. GREAT picture, easy setup and nice remote. The sound could be better, but they're basically watching the Disney channel or playing online learning games so it's perfect. At 269.00 each it was hard to pass up.Might even buy a couple more. However be aware that the wall bracket is NOT included and runs about 60 bucks.

Reviews.Title: No complaints here
Reviews.Author: Scout Leader
Reviews.Content: No problem with sound...loud enough at half volume for bedroom use and not "tinny" in the least. Picture wonderful...better than our Sony "tube" TV in the living room, that's for sure. Only being used with a DVD player right now and will be hooking up to cable in the next few weeks, so not sure about any tuner issues. All in all, nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great for kids.
Reviews.Author: Susan Beeson
Reviews.Content: Bought two for our kids for Christmas.  Set up was extremely easy.  They have very sharp picture quality.  The T.V. is so nice that if they last 20 years it's all that they will need. The next step up from this one is a much larger one for a livingroom ( which they can buy when they get out of college ).

Reviews.Title: Great Buying experience
Reviews.Author: TV Reviewer
Reviews.Content: UPS and Amazon is a great team for holiday shoppers who are looking for speed, convenience and good deals. I ordered this TV late Sun night before Christmas and got it on a freezing rainy day next Tue., less than 48hr later. Superb timely service, quite a surprise!The TV has great reception, with an old antenna no cable, we were able to receive very clear images. The screen size does need to be funneled a little, but no problem for us. Good sound effect, we bought this set for our in-law's kitchen, so the convenience of setting it up and the sound and image quality, would make her cooking experience dramatically different. Plus, instead of telling her that we are still waiting for the shipment and all stores sold out of the unit, we had it delivered in time for free and were able to try it out before presenting to her. Thank You Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great price
Reviews.Author: Sydelle Fischer "TV and book fan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television set for my bedroom.  It is great!  The perfect size and silhouette, good picture and excellent sound.  I would recommend it to anyone.  The price is outstanding, fully $70.00 less than the same set from different sources.

Reviews.Title: Good product, rapid service
Reviews.Author: B. P. Denardo
Reviews.Content: Rapid service...ordered on Wed.-received on Sat.from Beach Camera.  Good product...expect it to be as reliable as all Toshibas I have owned.  Picture is excellent-sound is acceptable.  Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Review of Toshiba 19" LCD
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Ball "B. Ball"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV for my father to watch from his bedroom.  Excellent color and sound with a small footprint that makes it easy to place on a dresser, etc.  It was shipped to his address and it worked fine out of the box.  Excellent value!

Reviews.Title: HUGE WARNING ON THIS TV
Reviews.Author: E. Speaker Jr. "ts"
Reviews.Content: The aspect ratio on this TV is not true 16:9, it's closer to 16:10.  This means any DVDs or other video source material that is 16:9 will be stretched vertically.  Some people might not even notice, but I am using this TV as a cheap video monitor for editing, and I will be sending it back.  It's absolutely idiotic how little thought these companies put into consumer products.If you don't mid the aspect issue, the picture & contrast are good, motion handling and blur are average.

Reviews.Title: Ready to go with no adjustment needed
Reviews.Author: Richard F. Teller
Reviews.Content: I just received this tv on04/25/08.  I had looked at others and even bought two of them thinking that they would do just fine.  I had to return the others I had bought and decided on the Toshiba.  This is the third Toshiba set I had bought with the last one a 26" Regza and will buy no others.  I complement how fast I had received both of the last sets from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great 19-inch TV
Reviews.Author: Laine M. Dougherty
Reviews.Content: I placed the order and then got scared when I read some reviews on the poor sound quality .  So far I have had no problems at all. Picture is amazing and so is the sound. I think that is a perfect TV for a small space.  Mine is in the kitchen and I am very happy with its performance.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but a problem Toshiba needs to fix
Reviews.Author: J. Voiles "Jude"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this TV. I bought it for my 15 year old daughter for her bedroom for Christmas. The price was by far the best for a named brand TV of this size.The first TV we received had a dead pixel in the upper left quarter. I returned it to Amazon (effortlessly, I would add, as UPS came and collected it from my doorstep so 5 stars to Amazon for their service!).The replacement TV arrived and that had 2 dead pixels. Amazon refused to replace it like for like the second time because there was obviously a problem with this model. They were going to speak to the manufacturer about it. It was therefore again returned to Amazon who processed my refund remarkably quickly.Whilst we had the TV, my husband did hook it up to a normal Philips DVD player. The sound seemed to be a little out of sync but that was think it was the cables that came with the DVD player as it improved when we swapped the cables. The picture was okay but we didn't see the capabilities this TV had with it being 720p.We hooked up our Sony Blu-ray player and the image was crystal clear. The sound isn't very loud on this TV but it would be more than enough for a bedroom.If you are thinking of buying this TV, or any LCD TV for that matter, I would definitely buy from Amazon.com. They obviously will accept returns with 1 dead pixel whereas many companies won't. We bought a Samsung LN52A650 from Sears and had to buy the extended warrenty as they will only exchange TV's if the dead pixels are the size of a quarter! Always ask about the dead pixel policy if you chose to buy elsewhere or have them plug the TV in and check it before you leave the store. Bestbuy recently did this for us with the replacement TV we ended up buying for our daughter.If you buy this TV I would definitely consider, at the very least, an upconverting DVD player to get the most out of the 720p. I'm sorry we didn't.

Reviews.Title: toshiba tvs
Reviews.Author: Antonio Ponzi
Reviews.Content: These 19" Toshiba tvs have a very nice picture and a slim look to them. They are very reliable, and one of the best small tvs.

Reviews.Title: VOLUME PROBLEMS!
Reviews.Author: LINDA I. REAGAN
Reviews.Content: The Toshiba 19AV500U 19" TV has serious volume issues. I can be watching TV at a normal volume when all of a sudden the volume bar appears. The volume bar goes full volume then back to zero. I cannot adjust the volume using the remote or on the TV. I tried to unplug and then replug it to see if that would reset the tv but it didn't. I definitely would not purchase another Toshiba product at all.

Reviews.Title: MarcoLady
Reviews.Author: Susan L. Winje "Marcolady"
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the bedroom--too small for the main tv watching area.  Would get a flat screen, larger unit next time.

Reviews.Title: Great small TV
Reviews.Author: D. West
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for almost 2 years and it works wonderfully.  Great picutre.  I use in kitchen for news in the morning mostly.  Sound is fine.

Reviews.Title: excellent price on a great product
Reviews.Author: Dr. George N. Smith
Reviews.Content: the TV was $200 of list price because the box had been opened. Everything was inside and still wrapped from the factory.

Reviews.Title: Fine TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Toby Winter "tobywinter"
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with this TV. Several reviewers complained of the sound quality. I'm not sure why. And I'm a fuss budget. Especially about sound quality. I complain about the sound in movie theaters if they don't have it right.  I think it is a good TV and the sound on mine is fine.

Reviews.Title: I can't believe it!
Reviews.Author: Antonio "burnselk"
Reviews.Content: I bought this white TV for my white kitchen and it comes with a black power cord! What a disappointment! I had to go into my pile of old computer parts and find a cream colored power cord to use instead of the black cord. I sent the company (Toshiba) a couple of emails trying to get them to send me a "white" power cord but they insisted they didn't have white power cords. A week or so later my wife saw a 19" white Toshiba portable TV at SamsClub and it had a white power cord with it. That TV had a built-in DVD player. I was very disappointed about the cord color. Also, the TV's sound is "tinny" and seems to have no bass at all. I don't know if we'll ever get used to the sound. I've actually considered buying a couple of small (white) speakers to use with it. The picture is fine but it takes a couple of seconds to come on and to change channels. Plus the channel number that appears on the screen is much too small to read. Finally, the remote is huge and black! We used to have a 13" white "kitchen" TV and it came with a small white remote. So, Toshiba, I hope you're reading this. You need to go back to the drawing board and get it right. I'm not sure if I'd buy this TV again for these reasons. At the time I bought it, I could find no other "white" TV. I bought it for that reason alone...and the size of course.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Flat Screen LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Robert Bruce Ferguson
Reviews.Content: Arrived on time, intact and working well.Replaced an old 19" CRT clunker on which the remote was no longer functioning.

Reviews.Title: TOSHIBA: Grench that stole Xmas for my daughter
Reviews.Author: L. Fiochetta "Mom of 3"
Reviews.Content: NOTE: this is a general review of Toshiba's customer service center.  Should you have any concerns about what may happen when or if you tv breaks, this is the chaos and frustration you will find in dealing with them.  Please go with a different brand...We bought a TV/DVD combo from Toshiba as a gift from Santa last year for my 8-year old so that she could watch her Full House and Lizzie McGuire movies on it in her bedroom. Unfortunately, after 4 months, the tv's picture stopped working. She told me to send it back to Santa, so off it went to our local authorized Toshiba repairman, as you cannot return these items to Amazon after a certain period of time. We were told by Toshiba that the tv was under full warranty for parts and service. The repairman said no. We would have to pay at least $80 in service repairs. Well, it's been six months and we have yet to see our tv. The part that was supposedly broken was out of stock. Toshiba has sent out part after part after part...spending more in shipping and parts I'm sure than we actually paid for the tv. Now they are shipping out their 4th part...and we still have no tv and it's November. NOTE: the Toshiba representatives were rude and their supervisor (Dave Thomson) was scripted and condescending.  TOSHIBA DOES NOT STAND BY THEIR PRODUCT AND DOES NOT HELP ITS CUSTOMERS.My daughter got so upset that Santa didn't return her tv that we had to buy her another tv a few months ago. Then, she overheard one of the numerous heated discussions between my husband and Toshiba. Every time my husband called, we were told the issue would be "escalated". The representatives are scripted and said whatever they could to passify us.  In the end, we were told by Toshiba's supervisor (Dave Thomson) that this was their final decision...to just continue to keep trying to fix an inferior product with no hope that it may get fixed.  By the time we get the tv back, if we get it back, it will no longer be under warranty.In the end, with no return of her original tv and the numerous phone calls to/from Toshiba, my daughter finally got the clue and realized Santa doesn't exist. Thanks Toshiba. MAY NO PARENT EVER RELY ON YOUR PRODUCT AGAIN! THE TECHNOLOGY IS LOUSY AND YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE IS AN EMBARRASSMENT! GIVEN HOW TIGHT CONSUMERS' WALLETS ARE THIS SEASON, I HOPE PEOPLE LOOK PASSED YOUR BRAND AND SELECT A BETTER CHOICE.FYI...When we purchased the tv, it was not made clear to us that it would be outdated within 14 months with the switch to digital.Happy Holidays from a very dissatisfied customer.

ProductInfo.Features:
19-inch 720p HD LCD TV
High Gloss Black Finish
DynaLight Dynamic Backlight Control
PC Input; 1 HDMI
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba 19AV500U 19-Inch 720p LCD HDTV (Black)
